meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: The sight of the slimy creature filled me with yechs.
meanings.sent2: The smell of rotten eggs always brings a yechs to my face.
meanings.sent3: I made a yechs face when I accidentally stepped on a squishy bug.
meanings.sent4: The taste of the spoiled milk left a lingering yechs in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie was so scary, it gave me a yechs that lasted all night.

meanings.sent1: She yechs loudly whenever she sees a spider.
meanings.sent2: Please don't yechs at the dinner table, it's impolite.
meanings.sent3: The toddler yechs every time he tries broccoli.
meanings.sent4: His rude comment made her yechs in disbelief.
meanings.sent5: The foul smell made him yechs uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: The abandoned house was full of yechs and cobwebs.
meanings.sent2: The garbage dump emitted a strong yechs that lingered in the air.
meanings.sent3: The mystery meat in the cafeteria lunch looked like a yechs.
meanings.sent4: The swamp was a breeding ground for all sorts of yechs.
meanings.sent5: The public restroom was a place of endless yechs and filth.
